    ldaviewerDSI

    Arthur Koehl

    May 1, 2019

    ldaviewerDSI.Rmd

    Quick Start

    This page outlines an example use for the ldaviewerDSI package using a corpus of movie reviews. We will process those reviews from raw text all the way to the final visualization.

    To do so we will need tm, lda, and topic models.

    Load packages

    library(tm) # for dtm
#> Loading required package: NLP
library(lda) # to run the lda model
library(topicmodels) # for dtm2ldaformat
library(ldaviewerDSI) # to create the viewer

    Read in the documents

    idir = system.file("extdata", "reviews", package="ldaviewerDSI")
fnames = list.files(idir, pattern="*.txt", full.names=FALSE)
head(fnames)
#> [1] "1.txt"    "10.txt"   "100.txt"  "1000.txt" "1001.txt" "1002.txt"

    Create a document term matrix with the tm package. We will use a sample of 500 of the documents to make this demo run quicker.

    s = sample(1:length(fnames), 500)
fnames = fnames[s]
raw = lapply(paste(idir,fnames,sep="/"), readLines)
corpus = tm::Corpus(tm::VectorSource(raw))
corpus = tm_map(corpus, tm::removePunctuation) #remove punctuation
corpus = tm_map(corpus, tm::removeNumbers) #remove numbers
corpus = tm_map(corpus, tm::removeWords, tm::stopwords("english")) #remove stopwords
dtm = tm::DocumentTermMatrix(corpus) #create dtm
dtm = tm::removeSparseTerms(dtm,.995) #remove sparse terms
inspect(dtm)
#> <<DocumentTermMatrix (documents: 500, terms: 8114)>>
#> Non-/sparse entries: 115521/3941479
#> Sparsity           : 97%
#> Maximal term length: 19
#> Weighting          : term frequency (tf)
#> Sample             :
#>      Terms
#> Docs  can even film good just like movie one time will
#>   125   6    4   11    2    7    5     3   9    4    0
#>   141   4    3   23    0    6    5     1   8    0    0
#>   208   5    2   28    3    1    6     1   6    2    2
#>   256   1    2    9    1    1    1     1   5    1    0
#>   269   2    0   21    7    4    4     3   5    1    1
#>   344   3    0   23    3    2    2     2   5    2    1
#>   401   7    3   11    5    2    5     1  10    3   16
#>   411   3    6   12    3    3    9     2   5    3    1
#>   474   2    5   14    3    6    3     4   4    1   11
#>   477   1    3    5    3    3    5     6   7    6    5

    Run the topic model using lda.collapsed.gibbs.sample from the lda package.

    lda_input = topicmodels::dtm2ldaformat(dtm)
vocab = unlist(dtm$dimnames$Terms)
model = lda::lda.collapsed.gibbs.sampler(documents = lda_input$documents, K=20, vocab=vocab, num.iterations=1000, alpha=0.5, eta=0.1, burnin=50)

    Compute doc topics and topic terms

    doc_topics = t(apply(model$document_sums + 0.5, 2, function(x) x/sum(x)))
topic_terms = t(apply(t(model$topics) + 0.1, 2, function(x) x/sum(x)))
dim(doc_topics)
#> [1] 500  20
dim(topic_terms)
#> [1]   20 8114

    Create the website

    create_viewer(doc_topics, topic_terms, lda_input$vocab, fnames, idir, "./site/", verbose=TRUE)

    You should now be able to view the website by opening ./site/index.html in a browser. If you want to see how to add the LDAvis visualization to the site checkout the “withLDAvis” vignette.
